conclusion: Understand the relationship between magnetic induction, angular velocity, and induced current in a rotating wire frame.
Induced current I can be calculated using the formula I = (3/2)πnBSω.
n is the number of turns, B is the magnetic induction, S is the area, and ω is the angular velocity.
Average value of induced EMF Ē can be calculated using the formula Ē = (3/2)πnBSω.
Find the instantaneous value of induced current and average value of induced EMF when the wire frame rotates through 60°.
Area S of the wire frame is 1 square meter.
Angular velocity ω is 60° or π/3 radians per second.
Plug values into the formula I = (3/2)π(π/3) × 1 × (π/3) = π²/4.
Instantaneous value of the induced current is π²/4 amperes.
Average value of the induced EMF is the same as the instantaneous value of the induced current.
Average value of the induced EMF is π²/4 volts.
Summary: Instantaneous value of the induced current is π²/4 amperes; average value of the induced EMF is π²/4 volts.
